analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: dependent origination has no characteristic of dependent origination,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar la yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar la yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: up to the very limit of reality has no characteristic of the very limit of reality.

original: mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: Nor does a defining mark have the intrinsic nature of a defining mark.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la'ang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la'ang mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: Nor does the intrinsic nature of a defining mark have the intrinsic nature of a defining mark.🔽Subhūti said,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de /
translated: will those bodhisattva great beings who train in this training

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: go forth to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who train in this training will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ma skyes /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ma skyes /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽it is because all dharmas are unborn and

original: ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: unoriginated.”🔽Śāriputra said,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad ma skyes /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad ma skyes /
translated: How is it that all phenomena are unborn?🔽

original: ma byung ba yin /
analyzed: ma byung ba yin /
translated: How are all phenomena unarisen and non-occurring?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste /
translated: form is empty of form;

original: de la skye ba'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de la skye ba'ang mi dmigs /
translated: its arising is not apprehended and its occurrence is not apprehended.

original: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ste /🔽de la skye pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ste / de la skye pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty of consciousness;

original: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: its arising is not apprehended and its occurrence is not apprehended.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i @200b bar du yang dag pa'i mthas stong ste /🔽de la skye ba'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i @200b bar du yang dag pa'i mthas stong ste / de la skye ba'ang mi dmigs /
translated: Up to the very limit of reality, the very limit of reality is empty;

original: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: its arising is not apprehended and its occurrence is not apprehended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in this way,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin te /
translated: they are close to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nye bar gyur ba de lta de ltar /
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nye bar gyur ba de lta de ltar /
translated: The more they approach omniscience, the more they will be able to help sentient beings.🔽

original: lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he approaches the knowledge of all modes, the more he will obtain a pure body, a pure speech, a pure thought, and a pure mark.

original: de ji lta ji ltar lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: The more he obtains a pure body, a pure speech, a pure thought, and a pure mark, the more that Bodhisattva, that great being, will not produce a thought associated with passion,

original: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang / g-yo dang sgyu dang ldan pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna dang ldan pa dang / sred pa dang ldan pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pa dang / nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang / g-yo dang sgyu dang ldan pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna dang ldan pa dang / sred pa dang ldan pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed do //
translated: or associated with hatred, or associated with confusion, or associated with pride, or associated with deceit and hypocrisy, or associated with envy and avarice, or associated with craving, or associated with views.

original: de 'dod chags kyi sems mi skyed cing /
analyzed: de 'dod chags kyi sems mi skyed cing /
translated: He does not give rise to a mind of desire,

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sred pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pas /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sred pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pas /
translated: nor does he give rise to a mind of anger, ignorance, pride, deceit, hypocrisy, jealousy, stinginess, craving, or views.

original: nam yang ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He never takes birth in a womb,

original: khor zug rtag par brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khor zug rtag par brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but is always born miraculously.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don ma gtogs par nam yang @201a *//
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don ma gtogs par nam yang @201a *//
translated: Except for the purpose of ripening sentient beings,

original: ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he never takes birth in the lower realms.

original: de sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: de sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: He ripens sentient beings and purifies buddha-fields,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: and moves from buddha-field to buddha-field.

original: nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur gyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur gyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until they fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will never be separated from the lord buddhas.

original: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de bas na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan dang legs pa 'di dag thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yon tan dang legs pa 'di dag thob par 'dod pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to attain these good qualities and virtues

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brtson 'grus mi gtong bar spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brtson 'grus mi gtong bar spyad par bya ste /
translated: should practice this perfection of wisdom itself without letting up on their perseverance.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like this

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: are close to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u lnga pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifth chapter, “Approaching,” in “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; thabs mi mkhas pas /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe; thabs mi mkhas pas /
translated: If, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom, they practice without skillful means,

original: gzugs la spyod na mtshan ma la spyod de /
analyzed: gzugs la spyod na mtshan ma la spyod de /
translated: if they practice form, they practice a causal sign.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @201b dang; rnam par shes pa la spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @201b dang; rnam par shes pa la spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: Similarly, if they practice feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, they practice a causal sign.

original: gal te gzugs rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice ‘form is permanent,’ they practice a causal sign.

original: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is permanent,’ they practice a causal sign.

original: gal te gzugs mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice ‘form is impermanent,’ they practice a causal sign.

original: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are impermanent,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: gal te gzugs bde zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs bde zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Form is happiness,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are happiness,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: gal te gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Form is suffering,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes bsdug  bsngal zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes bsdug  bsngal zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are suffering,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: gal te gzugs bdag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs bdag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Form is a self,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one practices, saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are a self,’ one is practicing a sign.

original: gal te gzugs bdag med ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs bdag med ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Form is not self,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not self,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: gal te gzugs zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bgyi bar @202a *//
analyzed: gal te gzugs zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bgyi bar @202a *//
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Form is calm,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are calm,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: gal te gzugs ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Form is not calm,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not calm,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: gal te gzugs dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice thinking, ‘Form is empty,’ they are engaging with a sign.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice by saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are void,’ then they are practicing with signs.

original: gal te gzugs mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice by saying, ‘Form is not void,’ then they are practicing with signs.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If they practice by saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not void,’ then they are practicing with signs.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings, when they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mi mkhas pas skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pas skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang /
translated: without skillful means, practice the sense fields, elements, dependent origination, perfections, all the emptinesses, thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and noble truths,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang; rnam par thar ba rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang; rnam par thar ba rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative absorptions, the liberations, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes @202b pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes @202b pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: wishlessness, the extrasensory powers, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / mi dben pa zhes bgyi par spyod na mtshan ma la spyod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / mi dben pa zhes bgyi par spyod na mtshan ma la spyod de /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and to engage with the notions that they are permanent or impermanent, blissful or suffering, self or not self, peaceful or not peaceful, or void or not void—that is to say, to engage with them in any of these terms—is to engage with signs.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
translated: they are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
translated: think, ‘I am practicing the perfection of wisdom,’

original: dmigs pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: they are practicing with reference points.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings are practicing with reference points.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du gang de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du gang de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings think, ‘Those who practice like this

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom mo zhes bgyi bar spyod na'ang mtshan ma nyid la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom mo zhes bgyi bar spyod na'ang mtshan ma nyid la spyod pa ste /
translated: They are cultivating the perfection of wisdom,’ they are practicing with reference points.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: That should be known as the bodhisattva great beings’ lack of skill in means.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti,🔽“Venerable Su­bhūti!🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mi mkhas pa ji ltar rig par bya ba yin /🔽rab @203a *// 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mi mkhas pa ji ltar rig par bya ba yin / rab @203a *// 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Venerable Su­bhūti, how should we know the skillful means of great bodhisattva beings?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Su­bhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
analyzed: gzugs la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
translated: if they aspire to, conceive of, and bless physical forms,

original: de gzugs la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob pas /
analyzed: de gzugs la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob pas /
translated: then, by aspiring to, conceiving of, and blessing physical forms,

original: gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
analyzed: gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
translated: they will practice the composition of physical forms.

original: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
translated: I say that they will not be freed from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress.

original: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
translated: I say that they will not be freed from great suffering.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
translated: “If they are devoted to and conceptualize feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness, and then bless them,

original: de rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob pas /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob pas /
translated: then, because they are devoted to and conceptualize consciousness and bless it,

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
translated: they will engage in the formative predispositions of consciousness.

original: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
translated: I say that they will not be freed from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress.

original: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
translated: I say that they will not be freed from great suffering.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If, while bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mig la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: mig la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: they believe in the eye, conceive of it, and bless it,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: they believe in the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind, conceive of them, and bless them.

original: gzugs la mos shing 'du @203b shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: gzugs la mos shing 'du @203b shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They believe in form, conceive of it, and bless it.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They believe in sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental phenomena, conceive of them, and bless them.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They believe in eye consciousness, conceive of it, and bless it.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They believe in ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thinking-mind consciousness, conceive of them, and bless them.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They believe in eye contact, conceive of it, and bless it.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They aspire to and form concepts about, and then bless, auditory contact, olfactory contact, gustatory contact, tactile contact, and mental contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They aspire to and form concepts about, and then bless, the feeling that arises from the condition of visual contact,

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of auditory contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of olfactory contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of gustatory contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tactile contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of mental contact.

original: ma rig pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
analyzed: ma rig pa la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /
translated: They aspire to and form concepts about, and then bless, ignorance.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi @204a *//
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi @204a *//
translated: They are intent on and have a notion of, and so bless, the compounded and the uncompounded, and they are intent on and have a notion of, and so bless, the perfections, the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽

original: phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: They are devoted to and have perceptions of and bless the constituents, the sense fields, the dependent originations, the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / mig lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / mig lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis rlob na /
translated: the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the doors of liberation, the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽“If they aspire to and form mental constructs about the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis brlabs pas; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos shing 'du shes te byin gyis brlabs pas; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par 'du bya ba la spyod de /
translated: then, because they aspire to and form mental constructs about the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they practice in order to actualize the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /
translated: He will not be liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po las yongs su mi 'grol bar brjod do //
translated: He will not be liberated from suffering, I say.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽if a bodhisattva great being does not have the good fortune to actualize the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang mngon du bya ba'i skal ba med na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang mngon du bya ba'i skal ba med na /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya @204b ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya @204b ba lta ci smos te /
translated: how could he possibly attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner,

original: thabs mi mkhas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas par shes par bya'o //
translated: they should be known as unskilled in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na thabs mkhas par shes par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na thabs mkhas par shes par bya /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom be known as skilled in means?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang mi spyod /
translated: and they do not practice feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi spyod /
translated: They do not practice the causal signs of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan ma la mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan ma la mi spyod /
translated: and they do not practice the causal signs of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not practice that form is permanent,

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag ces bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba dang / gzugs zhi zhes bya ba dang / gzugs ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag ces bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba dang / gzugs zhi zhes bya ba dang / gzugs ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: “Form is impermanent,” “Form is happiness,” “Form is suffering,” “Form is a self,” “Form is not a self,” “Form is peaceful,” “Form is not peaceful,”🔽“Form is empty,” “Form is not empty,” “Form has signs,” “Form is signless,” “Form has wishes,” and “Form is wishless.”

original: gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mi stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya ba dang /🔽gzugs dben zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / @205a *//
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mi stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya ba dang / gzugs dben zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod pa dang / tshor ba dang / @205a *//
translated: “Form is isolated” and “Form is not isolated.”🔽They do not engage with the notions that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are permanent,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
translated: or that they are impermanent,🔽happy, or suffering.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
translated: “impermanent,” “happiness,” “suffering,” “self,” “selfless,” “peaceful,” “not peaceful,” “empty,”

original: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod pa de'i tshe /
translated: “not empty,” “with signs,” “signless,” “having aspirations,” “having no aspirations,” “solitary,” or “not solitary.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o //
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should be known as skilled in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang gzugs ma yin /🔽stong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzugs med /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang gzugs ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzugs med /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽the emptiness of form is not form,🔽form is not other than emptiness,

original: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
translated: and emptiness is not other than form.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs /
translated: Emptiness is form.

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form is emptiness.🔽The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽Apart from emptiness there is no feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin /🔽stong pa nyid las gud na'ang rnam par shes pa med /🔽rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /🔽stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang rnam par shes pa med / rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de / stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa /
translated: Apart from feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness there is no emptiness.🔽Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong @205b pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong @205b pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang /
translated: The emptiness of the constituents, the emptiness of the sense fields, the emptiness of dependent origination, the emptiness of the perfections, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of the thirty-seven aspects of awakening, the emptiness of the noble truths, the emptiness of the concentrations, the emptiness of the immeasurables, the emptiness of the formless absorptions, the emptiness of the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness that is the nature of nonentities, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, the emptiness of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the emptiness of the inconceivable, the emptiness of the unapprehendable, the emptiness of the inapprehensible, the emptiness of the absence of an entity, the emptiness of the absence of a nonentity, the emptiness of essence, the emptiness of other, the emptiness of both, the emptiness of no beginning or end, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of the absence of nonthings, the emptiness of the absence of an intrinsic nature, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not repudiated, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not apprehended, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not observed, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not existent, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not nonexistent, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not pure, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not impure, the emptiness of the nature of nonthings that is not something to

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang /
translated: and the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin /🔽stong pa nyid las gud na'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med /
translated: are not the distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽Apart from emptiness there are no distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
translated: Apart from the distinct attributes of a buddha there is no emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams /
translated: emptiness is the buddhadharmas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: and the buddhadharmas are emptiness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /🔽thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o;; ;;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni / thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o;; ;;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that🔽should be known as skilled in means.”

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, Chapter Eleven

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @206a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @206a *//
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar skal pa yod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar skal pa yod do //
translated: have the good fortune to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang spyod do zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang spyod do zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: Although they practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not apprehend ‘I am practicing.’

original: mi spyod do zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi spyod do zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: “He does not engage” is not apprehended.🔽“He both engages and does not engage” is not apprehended.

original: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: “He neither engages nor does not engage” is not apprehended.

original: spyod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: spyod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “He engages” is not apprehended.🔽“He does not engage” is not apprehended.🔽“He both engages and does not engage” is not apprehended.

original: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: “He neither engages nor does not engage” is not apprehended.🔽Subhūti replied,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci'i phyir na /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: why is it that when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend ‘he engages,’

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend ‘he does not engage,’🔽they do not apprehend ‘he both engages and does not engage,’

original: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend ‘he neither engages nor does not engage,’

original: spyod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: spyod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: they do not apprehend ‘he engages,’🔽they do not apprehend ‘he does not engage,’🔽they do not apprehend ‘he both engages and does not engage,’

original: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs pa yin /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs pa yin / rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: and they do not apprehend ‘he neither engages nor does not engage’?

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is because the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the perfection of wisdom has the nature of being a nonexistent thing.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: for these reasons, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so //
translated: they do not apprehend anything that is said to be practiced.

original: mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs @206b so; ;spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so //🔽spyod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs @206b so; ;spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so // spyod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They do not apprehend anything that is said to be not practiced. They do not apprehend anything that is said to be both practiced and not practiced.

original: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya bar yang mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend anything that is said to be neither practiced nor not practiced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du khong du chud cing ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du khong du chud cing ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because they have understood and do not grasp that all things have the nature of being nonexistent things.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gal te sems ma zhum; kun tu ma zhum /
analyzed: gal te sems ma zhum; kun tu ma zhum /
translated: are not timid, not cowed,

original: mi skrag / kun tu mi skrag /
analyzed: mi skrag / kun tu mi skrag /
translated: not afraid, not terrified,

original: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: and not gripped by fear,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that those bodhisattva great beings have approached the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'ang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'ang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: And that knowledge of all aspects, because all phenomena are without essence,

original: gnyis su med gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med gnyis su byar med do //
translated: is nondual and indivisible.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is the bodhisattva great beings’ meditative stabilization called ‘nonarising of all phenomena.’

original: rgya che ba mchog tu bya ba tshad med par nges pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba mchog tu bya ba tshad med par nges pa /
translated: It is vast, supreme, immeasurable, and certain.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa ste; ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa ste; ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with this samādhi will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment.”

original: smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di 'ba' zhig gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @207a *//🔽tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di 'ba' zhig gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @207a *// tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: is it only by practicing with this samādhi that the bodhisattva mahāsattva will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment,

original: 'on te de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag kyang yod /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag kyang yod /
translated: or are there other such samādhis?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag la rnam par spyod pas kyang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag la rnam par spyod pas kyang /
translated: by practicing with other samādhis as well,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba yod do //
translated: “There are, Śāriputra,” said the Lord, “bodhisattva great beings who quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang dag gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang dag gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin /
translated: what other meditative stabilizations do bodhisattva great beings who practice in those meditative stabilizations quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: there is a meditative stabilization of bodhisattva great beings called Heroic Valorous.

original: ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with this samādhi will quickly awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: Similarly, there is the Ratnamudrā-samādhi.

original: sengge rnam par rtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽zla ba bzang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: sengge rnam par rtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // zla ba bzang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the Siṃhavijṛmbhitā-samādhi.🔽There is the Su-candra-samādhi.

original: zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the Candra-dhvaja-śrī-samādhi.🔽There is the Sarva-dharma-viṣṭambhana-samādhi.

original: chos thams cad @207b kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad @207b kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the Sarva-dharma-mudra-samādhi.

original: spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the Uṣṇīṣa-viṣṭambhana-samādhi.

original: chos kyi dbyings su nges pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su nges pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called ascertainment of the basic space of phenomena.

original: nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called glorious banner of ascertainment.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called vajra.

original: chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called the seal of engagement with all phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called abiding like a king in absorption.

original: 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called radiating light rays.

original: dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called arrayed army.

original: yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called exalted.

analyzed: phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the meditative absorption called filling the sky.🔽There is the meditative absorption called vajra maṇḍala.🔽There is the meditative absorption called victory banner’s crest jewel.

analyzed: dbang po'i dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the meditative absorption called glory of the senses.

analyzed: rgyun gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // tshol ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: gnas la brten pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

translated: There is an absorption called “no mind.”🔽There is an absorption called “stainless lamp.”

analyzed: 'od mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “universal illumination.”

analyzed: dag pa dam pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: dga' ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: glog gi sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: gzi brjid yod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // zad pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: chos kyi 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: yi ge mnyam par 'gong pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: ming nges par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // gnas med par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called engaging with names.🔽There is an absorption called conduct without abode.

original: rab ri ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rab ri ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

original: g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: yul las brdal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // yon tan @209a *//

analyzed: thams cad kyi tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: sems med par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: spobs pa mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: chos thams cad las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: gcig tu rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

analyzed: rnam par 'dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

original: srid pa'i gzhi thams cad rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i gzhi thams cad rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “understanding the basis of all existence.”🔽There is an absorption called “engaging with words and sounds.”

analyzed: sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

original: sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //

original: mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “purifying characteristics. ”

original: mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge @209b 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge @209b 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “non-apprehending. ”

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “endowed with the highest of all aspects. ”

analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “without delight in any happiness or suffering. ”
