analyzed: zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de //
translated: There is an absorption called “inexhaustible treasure. ”

original: gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “dhāraṇī intelligence. ”🔽There is an absorption called “eliminating all that is right and wrong. ”

original: 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “pacifying all conflict and cessation. ”

original: mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “without conflict or contradiction. ”

original: 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “stainless light.”

original: snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “endowed with essence.”🔽There is an absorption called “light of the full, stainless moon.”

original: glog gi 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: glog gi 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “lightning light.”

original: rgyan chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rgyan chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “great ornament.”

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “illuminating in all aspects.”

original: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “equality of meditative absorption.”

original: rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “endowed with the mode of being stainless and free from dust.”

original: nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is an absorption called “directed to the absence of afflictions.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: There is the meditative absorption called “free from afflictions and correctly applied to all that is associated with afflictions.

original: gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽de bzhin nyid @210a *//
analyzed: gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // de bzhin nyid @210a *//
translated: ” There is the meditative absorption called “effortless with respect to the non-apprehension of objects.

original: la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: ” There is the meditative absorption called “abiding in suchness and devoid of mind.

original: lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel bas rab tu 'dul pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
analyzed: lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel bas rab tu 'dul pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //
translated: ” There is the meditative absorption called “subduing through the elimination of the faults of the body.

original: ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod do // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: ” There is the meditative absorption called “like space and devoid of destruction through the elimination of the faults of speech.🔽” There is the meditative absorption called “unobstructed and free from the darkness of ignorance.

original: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: ” There is the meditative absorption called “free from attachment and liberated like space.🔽”

original: ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin des rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice with those samādhis will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: those are the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ samādhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice with those samādhis will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo gang la bslabs pas /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo gang la bslabs pas /
translated: Thus, having trained in the dhāraṇī gateway,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu tshad med grangs med pa gzhan dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de lta bu tshad med grangs med pa gzhan dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also other countless, immeasurable bodhisattva great beings who will quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yang 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yang 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: venerable Subhūti said this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: @210b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rnam par spyod pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: @210b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rnam par spyod pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who practice with those meditative stabilizations have been prophesied by the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the past

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In that way, in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag gis kyang /
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, and completely perfect buddhas who are present, live, and remain in the worlds of the ten directions,🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to /
translated: and the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas who are alive at present, who are living, and are enduring, and are present in the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, they too will prophesy that the bodhisattva great being will awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni ting nge 'dzin kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva great being does not see even the meditative stabilization.

original: bdag ni snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya bar ting nge 'dzin des rlom sems su 'gyur ba'ang med do //🔽bdag ni snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag ni snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya bar ting nge 'dzin des rlom sems su 'gyur ba'ang med do // bdag ni snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He does not become conceited because of that meditative stabilization, thinking, ‘I have entered meditative stabilization.’🔽‘I am entering meditative stabilization.’

original: bdag gis mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: ‘I will enter meditative stabilization.’🔽‘I am in meditative stabilization.’

original: bdag ni mnyam par bzhag par gyur to zhes rlom sems su 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: bdag ni mnyam par bzhag par gyur to zhes rlom sems su 'gyur ba med de /
translated: He does not become conceited.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med cing mi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med cing mi rgyu'o //
translated: All those thoughts do not exist and do not occur to him.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan pa yod dam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan pa yod dam /
translated: “Subhūti, do the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones prophesy the great bodhisattva beings who stand in these meditative stabilities?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ni med do //
analyzed: de ni med do //
translated: they do not.”

original: de @211a *// ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de @211a *// ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: it is not the case that the perfection of wisdom is one thing,

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan /
translated: the meditative stabilities are another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med kyi /
translated: and the bodhisattvas are yet another.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to //🔽ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to // ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the meditative stabilities,🔽the meditative stabilities themselves are the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and the bodhisattvas themselves are the meditative stabilities.”🔽Śāriputra then asked,

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gal te de ltar ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba med /
translated: “If it is said, ‘The bodhisattva is one thing, and meditative stabilization is another,’ that is not the case.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan zhes bya ba med de /
translated: If it is said, ‘The bodhisattva is one thing, and meditative stabilization is another,’ that is not the case.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: Because all phenomena are the same, meditative stabilization is the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin na /
translated: and the bodhisattva is meditative stabilization.🔽“Is it possible to teach meditative stabilization here?”

original: de la ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam; rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin bstan par nus sam; rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: that is not the case.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāradvatīputra asked,

original: rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la 'du shes su byed dam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la 'du shes su byed dam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, does that son of a good family form the conception of that meditative stabilization?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'du shes su byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'du shes su byed pa med do //
translated: he does not form a conception.”🔽Śāradvatīputra asked,

original: smras pa / ji ltar de la 'du shes su byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar de la 'du shes su byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: “How does he not form a conception?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because there is no conceptualization.”🔽Śāriputra asked:

original: smras pa / de la ji ltar rtog pa med pa yin /
analyzed: smras pa / de la ji ltar rtog pa med pa yin /
translated: “How is there no conceptualization?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir rtog pa med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir rtog pa med de /
translated: “Because all phenomena are nonexistent, there is no conceptualization.

original: de ltar na rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la rtog pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la rtog pa med do //
translated: In that way, son of a good family, there is no conceptualization in that meditative stabilization.”

original: @211b tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: @211b tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la rnam par shes par byed pa med do //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu de ting nge 'dzin de la rnam par shes par byed pa med do //
translated: by this one of many explanations, son of a good family, there is no consciousness in that meditative stabilization.

original: 'du shes su byed pa med do //🔽smras pa / ci'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa med cing /
analyzed: 'du shes su byed pa med do // smras pa / ci'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa med cing /
translated: There is no perception.🔽Śāradvatīputra asked:

original: 'du shes su 'gyur ba med /
analyzed: 'du shes su 'gyur ba med /
translated: “Why is there no consciousness and no perception?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽ting nge 'dzin de'ang med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / ting nge 'dzin de'ang med la /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'ang med pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa med do; ;'du shes su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'ang med pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa med do; ;'du shes su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: “Because that meditative stabilization does not exist and because that bodhisattva great being does not exist, there is no consciousness and no perception.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhuti:

original: rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: Excellent, Subhuti, excellent!

original: legs so // tshig 'di ni legs par bshad do //
analyzed: legs so // tshig 'di ni legs par bshad do //
translated: You have spoken well!

original: ji ltar ngas nyon mongs pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa'i nyan thos kyi nang na mchog tu bshad pa des bshad pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ngas nyon mongs pa med pa la rnam par spyod pa'i nyan thos kyi nang na mchog tu bshad pa des bshad pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the way in which the Tathagata has explained the perfection of wisdom to the disciples, as the foremost of those who course in the perfection of wis­ dom, who course in skill in means, who course in the perfection of giving, who course in the perfection of morality, patience, vigour, concentration and wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train in the perfection of concentration, in the perfection of vigour, in the perfection of patience, in the perfection of morality, in the perfection of giving.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la bslab par bya'o; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la bslab par bya'o; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Śāradvatī­putra asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes @212a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes @212a *//
translated: “Blessed One,🔽when bodhisattva great beings train in that way, they train in the perfection of wisdom

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
translated: by way of not apprehending anything.🔽They train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
translated: by way of not apprehending anything.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob po //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob po //
translated: trains in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to trains in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, without taking anything as a basis.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
translated: bodhisattva great beings training like that train in the perfection of wisdom without taking anything as a basis.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving without taking anything as a basis.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, without taking anything as a basis.”🔽“Lord, if bodhisattva great beings training like that train in the perfection of wisdom without taking anything as a basis,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du mi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du mi dmigs pa lags /
translated: why is it not apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs so //
translated: the self is not apprehended because of utter purity.

original: sems can dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang @212b zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shed pa po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang @212b zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shed pa po mi dmigs so //
translated: Sentient beings, living beings, creatures, individuals, humankind, humans, embodied beings, persons, agents, experiencers, and knowers are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of utter purity,

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi dmigs so //
translated: the aggregates, sense spheres, and elements, and dependent origination are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, suffering is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, the origin, cessation, and path are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, the desire realm is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs so //
translated: the form element is non-apprehensible, owing to its utter purity;

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
translated: the formless element is non-apprehensible, owing to its utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: The perfections are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang /
translated: The dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the aspects of liberation,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi @213a *//
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi @213a *//
translated: the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽great love,🔽great compassion,🔽

original: chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of being extremely pure, a stream enterer is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of being extremely pure, a once-returner, a non-returner, a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of being extremely pure, a bodhisattva is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of being extremely pure, awakening is not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of being extremely pure, a buddha is not apprehended.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: rnam par dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gang lags /
translated: what is pure?”🔽The Blessed One replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'di ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All phenomena are unborn, unceasing, unafflicted, unpurified, non-arisen, non-ceased, and without reference point.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: in this way, bodhisattva great beings train in all phenomena without apprehending anything.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāradvatīputra then asked,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dang gang la slob pa lags /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dang gang la slob pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, in what phenomena do bodhisattva great beings who train in this way train?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos gang la'ang slob pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos gang la'ang slob pa med do //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who train in this way do not train in any phenomena at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: @213b chos 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bos ji ltar mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @213b chos 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bos ji ltar mngon par chags par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: These phenomena do not exist in the way that foolish, ordinary beings are attached to them.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'o na chos 'di dag rnam pa gang gis mchis pa lags /
analyzed: 'o na chos 'di dag rnam pa gang gis mchis pa lags /
translated: then how do these phenomena exist?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod de /
translated: “They exist in the way that they do not exist.

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Because they do not exist in that way,

original: de'i phyir med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med ces bya'o //
translated: they are said to not exist.”🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ci'i slad du mchis pa ma lags pa de la mchis pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du mchis pa ma lags pa de la mchis pa zhes bgyi /
translated: why is it that what does not exist is said to exist?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: gzugs nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because form does not exist due to inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no; ;byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no; ;byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature;🔽because the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams med pa la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams med pa la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: “In this regard, foolish, ordinary people, attached to nonexistence,

original: sred pa la mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: sred pa la mngon par zhen te /
translated: are attached to craving.

original: de dag gis med pa yongs su brtags pas /
analyzed: de dag gis med pa yongs su brtags pas /
translated: Because of their imagination of nonexistence,

original: med pa la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: med pa la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: they are attached to nonexistence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags pas /
analyzed: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags pas /
translated: They are attached to the extremes of annihilation and permanence.

original: de dag mi shes @214a *//
analyzed: de dag mi shes @214a *//
translated: They do not know

original: mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mi mthong ste /
translated: and do not see.

original: gang med pa'i chos de dag yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: gang med pa'i chos de dag yongs su brtags nas /
translated: Having imagined those nonexistent phenomena,🔽they are attached to name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa de dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa de dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: They are attached to the applications of mindfulness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
translated: up to they are attached to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag de ltar mngon par zhen pas yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: de dag de ltar mngon par zhen pas yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yongs su rtog ste /
translated: Since they are attached in that way, they imagine nonexistent phenomena.

original: de dag mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see.

original: ci mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
translated: What is it that they do not know and do not see?

original: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see form.🔽They do not know and do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know or see the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know or see the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ltar de dag ni byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'dong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'dong ba ste /
translated: In that way, they are counted as childish,

original: de dag 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: but they do not come into being.

original: gang nas 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: From where do they not come into being?

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no //🔽gzugs kyi khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no // gzugs kyi khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not come into being from the desire realm.🔽They do not come into being from the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not come into being from the formless realm.🔽They do not come into being from the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis nas 'byung ba ma yin no; ;de dag ni yid mi ches pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis nas 'byung ba ma yin no; ;de dag ni yid mi ches pa ste /
translated: They do not believe.

original: ji ltar yid mi ches zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid mi ches zhe na /
translated: How do they not believe?

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong zhes bya bar yid mi ches so //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong zhes bya bar yid mi ches so //
translated: They do not believe that ‘form is empty of form.’

original: byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong zhes bya bar yid @214b mi ches so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong zhes bya bar yid @214b mi ches so //
translated: They do not believe that ‘awakening is empty of awakening.’

original: de dag ni gnas pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni gnas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: They are not settled.

original: ji ltar gnas pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they do not stand?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin /
translated: they do not stand in the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, or perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not stand in the irreversible stage, up to they do not stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: They are attached.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they attached?

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: they are attached to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness;

original: mig la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: mig la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: they are attached to the eyes,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: They are attached to the different views.

original: byang chub kyi bar la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: They are attached to awakening.

original: de'i phyir na byis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na byis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called childish.🔽Śāriputra asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar slong pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob cing /
analyzed: de ltar slong pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob cing /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings who practice in that way not train in the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags sam /
translated: and do they not reach the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de @215a *// ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
analyzed: de @215a *// ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who train like that do not train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They do not emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa lags /
translated: why do those bodhisattvas not train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba lags /
translated: Why do they not emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, unskilled in means, have conceptualized and fixated on the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
translated: They are fixated on the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
translated: They are fixated on all the aspects of emptiness, the applications of mindfulness, the authentic abandonments, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brtags shing mngon par zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la brtags shing mngon par zhe na /
translated: and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa @215b brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa @215b brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la brtags shing mngon par zhen /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la brtags shing mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la brtags shing mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Up to and including the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob pa yin /
translated: For this reason, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings do not train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They do not emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam pa gang gis slob par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: de lta lags na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam pa gang gis slob par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: if that is so, in what way do bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba lags /
translated: How do they train to emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend the perfection of wisdom,

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: they do not see it,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: and, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this,

original: rnam pa @216a *//
analyzed: rnam pa @216a *//
translated: they will emerge

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: in the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: they do not apprehend that perfection of giving and do not see it as real.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend that knowledge of all aspects

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: and do not see it as real.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar slob pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar slob pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings training like that in the perfection of wisdom

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: will emerge in the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing like that in the perfection of wisdom and training like that in the perfection of wisdom

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: will emerge in the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba lags /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba lags /
translated: who will emerge in the knowledge of all aspects by way of not apprehending anything?”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Śāriputra!

original: nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo po nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa @216b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo po nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa @216b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the knowledge of all aspects by way of the nonapprehension of inner emptiness, up to the nonapprehension of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u drug pa'o ////
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u drug pa'o ////
translated: This was the sixth chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis; bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis; bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri zhing /
analyzed: la la zhig 'di skad du 'dri zhing /
translated: if someone were to ask,

original: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: ‘Does this illusory person train in the perfection of wisdom and emerge into the knowledge of all aspects?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchi na /
translated: Does he attain the knowledge of all aspects?’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi; ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi; ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of morality,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: and the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
translated: “Has this illusory person trained in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la bslabs shing /
translated: “Has this illusory person trained in the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?”🔽“Subhūti, if you ask, ‘Has this illusory person trained in the perfection of giving and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?’ you should say, ‘He has.’🔽If you ask, ‘Has this illusory person trained in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?’ you should say, ‘He has.’🔽If you ask, ‘Has this illusory person trained in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?’ you should say, ‘He has.’🔽If you ask, ‘Has this illusory person trained in the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha and will he emerge in the knowledge of all aspects?’ you should say, ‘He has.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes mchin /
translated: Will they attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: de skad du 'dri ba de la ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
translated: how should I explain to him who asks in this way?”

original: bcom @217a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @217a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: de khyod nyid la dri'i /
analyzed: de khyod nyid la dri'i /
translated: I will ask you this in return.

original: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar lung ston cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar lung ston cig /
translated: You should explain it as you understand it.

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽gzugs kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / gzugs kyang gzhan la /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Is form one thing and illusion another?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness one thing and illusion another?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, it is not so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: mig kyang gzhan la; sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig kyang gzhan la; sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the eye one thing and illusion another?

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang gzhan la /
translated: the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are one thing,

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and the illusion another?

original: gzugs kyang gzhan la; sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzhan la; sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyang gzhan la /
translated: Do you think that form is one thing and the illusion another?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Do you think that sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects are one thing and the illusion another?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Do you think that the eye consciousness is one thing and the illusion another?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Do you think that the ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness are one thing and the illusion another?

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig @217b yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig @217b yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that eye contact is one thing and the illusion another?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: and also the other ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind contact,

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and also the other illusion?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyi tshor ba'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyi tshor ba'ang gzhan la /
translated: And also the other feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact,

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and also the other illusion?

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'ang gzhan la /
translated: And also the other feeling that arises from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact,

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and also the other illusion?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de lta ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang gzhan la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang gzhan la /
translated: and up to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are one thing,

analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and an illusory person another?”

translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de lta ma lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang gzhan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang gzhan la /
translated: are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha one thing,

original: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: and an illusory person another?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de lta ma lags so //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bslabs nas /

translated: Will they attain the knowledge of all aspects?

analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phyung po lnga po 'di dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: in fact,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: 'du shes dang / brda dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad tsam gyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la skye ba'am /🔽'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar dmigs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / brda dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad tsam gyis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la skye ba'am / 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar dmigs par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Are the five perpetuating aggregates, up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, perceived as arising or ceasing, as afflicted or refined,🔽or as anything at all?🔽“

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that the five grasping heaps, up to and including the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, are perceived as produced or stopped, or as afflicted or purified, by way of a mere designation, a mere label, a mere linguistic convention, a mere expression, a mere conventional term?”

original: de ni mi 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Lord, that is not the case.”

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang la 'du shes med cing brda med pa dang / gdags pa med pa dang / tha snyad med pa dang / ming med pa dang / ming du gdags pa med pa dang / lus med pa dang / lus kyi las med pa dang / ngag med pa dang /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes med cing brda med pa dang / gdags pa med pa dang / tha snyad med pa dang / ming med pa dang / ming du gdags pa med pa dang / lus med pa dang / lus kyi las med pa dang / ngag med pa dang /
translated: Is it the case that that which is without ideation, without a label, without designation, without linguistic convention, without a name, without a nominal designation, without a body, without physical action, without speech, without verbal action, without mind, without mental action, without afflictions, and without purification is perceived as produced or stopped, or as afflicted or purified?”🔽“Lord, that is not the case.”🔽“Subhūti, what do you think?

original: ngag gi las med pa dang / yid med pa dang / yid kyi las med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: ngag gi las med pa dang / yid med pa dang / yid kyi las med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: “Will they who have trained in the perfection of wisdom, which is without form, without a defining mark, without perception, without a basis, without a foundation, without speech, without a mind, without mental activity, without arising, without ceasing, without defilement, and without purification,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: Will they attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid @220b stong pa nyid kyi par dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid @220b stong pa nyid kyi par dang /
translated: Similarly, will they who have trained in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, the perfection of giving, and the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nas /
translated: and in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bus bslab pa ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bslab par bgyi'o //

analyzed: phung po lnga po 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /

analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin de ni dmigs su ma mchis so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i phung po lnga po de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
