original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Will they emerge in omniscience?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni 'di ltar rmi lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rmi lam ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: it is because a dream has the nature of non-entity.

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin de ni dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin de ni dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: That nature of non-entity cannot be apprehended.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sgyu ma lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i phung po lnga po de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i phung po lnga po de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs shing /
translated: Will those five aggregates that are like an illusion, like a phantom, like an apparition, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like an echo train their practice in the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: and emerge in omniscience?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ni 'di ltar sgyu ma ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /🔽sgra brnyan ni @221b dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sgyu ma ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin / sgra brnyan ni @221b dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: It is because an illusion has the nature of being a non-entity,🔽an echo has the nature of being a non-entity,

original: mig yor ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /🔽chu zla ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /🔽smig rgyu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: mig yor ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin / chu zla ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin / smig rgyu ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: an optical aberration has the nature of being a non-entity,🔽the moon’s reflection in water has the nature of being a non-entity,🔽a mirage has the nature of being a non-entity,

original: sprul pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sprul pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin te /

analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rang bzhin de ni dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: That nature of being a non-entity cannot be apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: 'du shes ni rmi lam lta bu /
analyzed: 'du shes ni rmi lam lta bu /

original: 'du byed ni rmi lam lta bu /
analyzed: 'du byed ni rmi lam lta bu /

original: rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam lta bu ste /

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /

original: de ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: That is the five aggregates.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ste; rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
translated: That consciousness is the six sense bases.

original: de ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: That is the five aggregates.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sgra brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sgra brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: “Subhūti, form is like an echo.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sgra brnyan lta bu ste /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /

analyzed: tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni mig yor lta bu ste /

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
translated: That consciousness is the six sense bases.

original: de ni phung po lnga'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzugs @222a *//
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o // rab 'byor / gzugs @222a *//
translated: That is the five aggregates.

original: ni chu zla lta bu'o //
analyzed: ni chu zla lta bu'o //

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni chu zla lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni chu zla lta bu ste /

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /

analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: That is the five aggregates.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are like a mirage.

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
translated: That consciousness is the six sense fields.

original: de ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: That is the five aggregates.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Subhūti, form is like a magical creation.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are like a magical creation.

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po drug go /
translated: That consciousness is the six sense fields.

original: de ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: That is the five aggregates.

original: de dag ni nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag ni nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: They are not apprehended because of inner emptiness.

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: up to and including the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, are not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags na /
analyzed: de lta lags na /
translated: if that is the case,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas bstan pa 'di thos na 'jigs shing dngangs pa dang / skrag par mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas bstan pa 'di thos na 'jigs shing dngangs pa dang / skrag par mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: will bodhisattva great beings who are new to the vehicle not be afraid, alarmed, and terrified when they hear this teaching?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'ang yin la /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thabs kyang mi mkhas pa zhig ste /
translated: are unskilled in means with regard to the perfection of wisdom,

original: dge ba'i @222b bshes gnyen gyi lag tu'ang mi 'ongs na /
analyzed: dge ba'i @222b bshes gnyen gyi lag tu'ang mi 'ongs na /
translated: and do not come into the care of a spiritual friend,

original: 'jigs shing dngangs pa dang / skrag par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs shing dngangs pa dang / skrag par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be afraid, alarmed, and terrified.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bstan pa 'di thos na mi 'jigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bstan pa 'di thos na mi 'jigs /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings hear this teaching, they are not afraid,

original: mi dngangs mi skrag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa de gang lags /
analyzed: mi dngangs mi skrag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa de gang lags /
translated: What is the skillful means of practicing the perfection of wisdom without fear or terror?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar rtog ste /
translated: with a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects they investigate form as impermanent.

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend that.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar rtog ste /
translated: They investigate feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as impermanent.

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend that.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is the skillful means of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.”🔽“Blessed One, what is the skillful means of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: with a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects they investigate form as suffering,

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: but do not apprehend it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: They investigate feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as suffering,

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: but do not apprehend it.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyi @223a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyi @223a *//
translated: With a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects

original: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar rtog ste /
translated: they investigate form as selfless,

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: but do not apprehend it.🔽They investigate feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as selfless,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar rtog ste; de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar rtog ste; de mi dmigs so //
translated: but do not apprehend it.🔽With a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs zhi zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs zhi zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: they investigate form as calm,

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: but do not apprehend it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: They think that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are calm.

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: But they do not apprehend that.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs stong zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gzugs stong zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: “With a mind endowed with omniscience, they think that physical forms are empty.

original: de mi dmigs so; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar rtog ste /
analyzed: de mi dmigs so; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar rtog ste /
translated: But they do not apprehend that. They think that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are empty.

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med pa'i rnam par rtog par byed de / de mi dmigs so //
translated: He should form the idea that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are wishless.🔽He should form the idea that form is not something to be appropriated.

original: de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs so //
translated: He should form the idea that form is not a self.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam par rtog par byed de /🔽de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam par rtog par byed de / de mi dmigs so //
translated: He should form the idea that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a self.🔽He should form the idea that form is empty.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gzugs dben pa'i rnam par rtog par byed de / de mi dmigs so //
translated: He should form the idea that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.🔽He should form the idea that form is isolated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i rnam par rtog par byed de /🔽de mi dmigs so //

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
translated: This, Subhuti, is the skill in means of a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar rtog pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar rtog pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Subhuti: When a Bodhisattva, a great being, thus reflects, he thinks:

original: sems can thams cad la gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
translated: I will demonstrate Dharma to all beings, in such a way that they will not apprehend anything. I will demonstrate Dharma to all beings, saying: 'Form is impermanent.'

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
translated: I will demonstrate Dharma to all beings, saying: 'Feeling, perception, the saṃskāras, and consciousness are impermanent.'

original: gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to //
translated: I will demonstrate Dharma to all beings, saying: 'Form is suffering, without self, calm, empty, signless, wishless, without activity, and isolated.'

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par @225a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par @225a *//
translated: form is suffering, is without self, is calm, is empty, is signless, is wishless, is without formation, and is void;

original: shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to snyam mo //
analyzed: shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan to snyam mo //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are suffering, are without self, are calm, are empty, are signless, are wishless, are without formation, and are void.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyams pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyams pa med pa ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, this is the uncorrupted transcendent perfection of generosity of great bodhisattva beings.

original: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'jigs /
analyzed: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'jigs /
translated: Since it exists, great bodhisattva beings are not terrified,

original: mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they do not feel frightened or anxious.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang mi ldan pas /
translated: they do not possess the mental activity of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzugs gang mi rtag pa'i rnam par yid la byed pa de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
analyzed: gzugs gang mi rtag pa'i rnam par yid la byed pa de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to the form that is impermanent in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are impermanent in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is painful in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are painful in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is without a self in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang mi ldan pas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i rnam par yid la byed pa de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang mi ldan pas /

translated: He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are without a self in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is empty in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are empty in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is signless in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are signless in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.

original: gzugs gang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par yid la byed pa de mi @225b dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
analyzed: gzugs gang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par yid la byed pa de mi @225b dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to the form that is without wishes in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are without wishes in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is unconditioned in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are unconditioned in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the form that is isolated in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.🔽He attends to the feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are isolated in the sense of being mentally produced, but he does so without apprehending anything.

analyzed: chos de dag la mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam ba dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: “Those phenomena are the aspects of impermanence, the aspects of suffering, the aspects of no self, the aspects of peace, the aspects of emptiness, the aspects of signlessness, the aspects of wishlessness,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / bzod pa dang / mos pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the aspects of no composition, the aspects of no production, the aspects of no birth, the aspects of no sentient beings, the aspects of no life-force, the aspects of no individuals, the aspects of no owners, the aspects of voidness, the aspects of calmness, the aspects of non-entities, and the aspects of non-apprehension.

original: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “This is the perfection of patience of bodhisattva great beings, and because it exists, bodhisattva great beings do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @226a *//🔽phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @226a *//🔽phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
translated: With attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects, they thoroughly investigate form as impermanent in an unobservable manner.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
translated: They thoroughly investigate feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as impermanent in an unobservable manner.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang /
translated: They thoroughly investigate form as suffering, as selfless, as calm, as empty, as signless, as wishless, as having nothing to do with a performer,

original: dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /
translated: and as isolated in an unobservable manner.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /🔽mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go /🔽de ltar de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas mi gtong zhing /🔽brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rab tu rtog go / de ltar de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas mi gtong zhing / brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: “They are also to be fully understood as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless, and as calm,🔽empty, signless, wishless, and free from any formation or occurrence.🔽“In this way, they are not to be abandoned by those who are endowed with the gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽This is the perfection of diligence of the bodhisattva great beings.🔽

original: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de mi 'jigs mi @226b dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de mi 'jigs mi @226b dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
analyzed: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
translated: they should, with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects, think, using the method of not apprehending anything, that form is impermanent.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyi skabs mi 'byed pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyi skabs mi 'byed pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang /
translated: They should not give an opportunity for other nonvirtuous dharmas that are not conducive to enlightenment, such as attention connected with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, to arise.🔽They should think, using the method of not apprehending anything, that form is suffering, is not a self,

original: zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
translated: is calm, is empty, is signless, is wishless, is without formation, and is isolated.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang /
translated: They are not distracted from the mental activity of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and they are not distracted by other nonvirtuous factors that would hinder awakening.

original: rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang /
translated: They contemplate impermanence, suffering, no-self, peace, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing /
translated: no formation, and isolation, but they do so without apprehending anything.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan @227a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan @227a *//
translated: They are not distracted from the mental activity of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyis mi 'byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: pa'i yid la bya ba dang / mi dge ba de ma yin pa byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba gzhan gyis mi 'byed pa 'di ni /
translated: and they are not distracted by other nonvirtuous factors that would hinder awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gsam  gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gsam  gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of concentration of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: de yod pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro ////
translated: Because of this, the bodhisattva great beings do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The Twelfth Scroll

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam pa 'di ltar rab tu rtog ste /🔽gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin gyi /🔽gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam pa 'di ltar rab tu rtog ste / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin gyi / gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: at some point they contemplate in this way with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects:🔽“Form is not empty because of the emptiness of form.🔽Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not the emptiness of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Consciousness itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is consciousness.

original: mig gi stong pa nyid kyis mig stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi stong pa nyid kyis mig stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of the eyes is not the emptiness of the eyes.

original: mig nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The eyes themselves are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig go /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig go /
translated: Emptiness itself is the eyes.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid kyis yid stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid kyis yid stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind is not the emptiness of the thinking mind.

original: yid nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The thinking mind itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid do //
translated: Emptiness itself is the thinking mind.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin gyi /🔽gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin gyi / gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of a form is not the emptiness of a form.🔽A form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is a form.

original: sgra @227b dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi stong pa nyid kyis chos stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra @227b dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos kyi stong pa nyid kyis chos stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental phenomena is not the emptiness of mental phenomena.

original: chos nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The very nature of mental phenomena is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang chos so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang chos so //
translated: Emptiness is also mental phenomena.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of eye consciousness is not the emptiness of eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Eye consciousness is also emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is also eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi / yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness is not the emptiness of mind consciousness.🔽Mind consciousness is also emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is also mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the eye contact is empty because of the emptiness of eye contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Eye contact itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is eye contact.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking-mind contact are empty because of the emptiness of thinking-mind contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Thinking-mind contact itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is thinking-mind contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen @228a *//
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen @228a *//
translated: It is not that the feeling conditioned by eye contact is empty because of the emptiness of the feeling conditioned by eye contact.

original: gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The feeling conditioned by eye contact itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of the eye is not the emptiness of the eye-contact-produced feeling.🔽The emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is not the emptiness of the mind-contact-produced feeling.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi /🔽yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the mind-contact-produced feeling is not the emptiness of the mind-contact-produced feeling.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of the mind-contact-produced feeling is the mind-contact-produced feeling.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of the applications of mindfulness is not the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are also emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is also the applications of mindfulness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is not the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are also emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is also the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mkhas pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, this is the skillful means of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: thabs mkhas pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @228b dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bstan pa 'di thos na /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @228b dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bstan pa 'di thos na /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings endowed with that skillful means, when they hear this teaching,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngangs skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not be frightened, afraid, or terrified.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dge ba'i ba shes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
analyzed: dge ba'i ba shes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings who are supported by spiritual friends hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom,

original: mi 'jigs / mi dngangs /
analyzed: mi 'jigs / mi dngangs /
translated: they will not be frightened, afraid,

original: skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de gang lags /
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de gang lags /
translated: or terrified. What are those spiritual friends?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang /
translated: “Subhūti, who are the bodhisattva great beings’ spiritual friends?

original: de la gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
analyzed: de la gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
translated: They teach the doctrine that form is impermanent in such a way that they do not apprehend anything.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: They do not dedicate any of those wholesome roots

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: to the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas, except for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “They should teach the doctrine that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are impermanent,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: and they should not allow any of those wholesome roots to be dedicated toward the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas, except for the state of omniscience.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, this should be known as the spiritual mentor of great bodhisattva beings.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, the spiritual mentor of great bodhisattva beings is one who teaches them as follows:

original: gzugs sdug @229a *//
analyzed: gzugs sdug @229a *//
translated: ‘Physical forms are neither fettered by nor liberated from anything.

original: bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that form is suffering, in an unobservable way.🔽They teach the doctrine that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are suffering, in an unobservable way.🔽“They teach the doctrine that form is not a self, in an unobservable way.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs zhi zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs zhi zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a self, in an unobservable way.🔽“They teach the doctrine that form is calm, in an unobservable way.

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs stong zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /🔽'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya bar da mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs stong zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs mtshan ma med ces bya bar da mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: “They should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Form is calm,’ in a way that is not apprehended, and they should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Form is void,’ in a way that is not apprehended.🔽They should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are calm,’ in a way that is not apprehended, and they should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are void,’ in a way that is not apprehended.🔽They should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Form is signless,’ in a way that is not apprehended, and they should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are signless,’ in a way that is not apprehended.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: They should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Form is wishless,’ in a way that is not apprehended, and they should teach the doctrine saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are wishless,’ in a way that is not apprehended.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med ces @229b bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med ces @229b bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang /
translated: “Form is not non-appropriated” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.🔽“Form is empty” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.🔽“Form is not empty” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.🔽“Form is with signs” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.🔽“Form is signless” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.🔽“Form is wished for” is how they teach the Dharma in a way that is not apprehended.

original: 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / gzugs dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / tshor ba dang /

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa ste /

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s spiritual friend.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la /🔽mig mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig sdug bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la / mig mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig sdug bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being’s spiritual friend is one who,🔽in regard to the eye, teaches the doctrine that it is impermanent, and does so by way of not apprehending anything;🔽in regard to the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind, teaches the doctrine that they are impermanent, and does so by way of not apprehending anything;🔽in regard to the eye, teaches the doctrine that it is suffering, and does so by way of not apprehending anything;

They teach the doctrine that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are not a self, in an unobservable way.🔽“They teach the doctrine that the eye is calm, in an unobservable way. translated: the pratyekabuddha level, but to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They give teachings on the subject that the sensory element of the eyes, the sensory element of sights, and the sensory element of visual consciousness are suffering, but they do so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa bdag med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /

translated: They give teachings on the subject that the sensory element of the eyes, the sensory element of sights, and the sensory element of visual consciousness are non-self, but they do so by way of not apprehending anything.
