translated: “They teach the doctrine that the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the eyes are wishless, in an unobservable manner.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /🔽yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba smon pa med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba smon pa med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the feeling that arises from the union of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact is without aspirations, and they do so by way of not apprehending anything.🔽“They teach the doctrine that the feeling that arises from the union of the eye contact is without fabrication, and they do so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung pa'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung pa'i tshor ba dang /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the feeling that arises from the union of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact is without fabrication, and they do so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa @236a *//
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa @236a *//
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the eyes are void, and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
analyzed: las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the ears, the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the nose, the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the tongue, the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the body, and the feelings that arise from the sensory contact of the mental faculty are void, and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that all wholesome roots are void, and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: and does not cause them to be dedicated to the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni gang de la /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the spiritual friend of a bodhisattva great being is the one who,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar du mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
translated: in regard to the dharmas on the side of awakening, teaches the Dharma in such a way that they are not apprehended, saying, ‘They are impermanent,’ ‘They are suffering,’ ‘They are selfless,’ ‘They are calm,’ ‘They are empty,’

original: mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing; dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing; dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: and “signless,” and “wishless,” and “unconditioned,” and “isolated,” and he teaches the doctrine that those [attributes] are not apprehended, and he teaches the doctrine that the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are cultivated, and he teaches the doctrine that those [attributes] are not apprehended, and he does not cause all those wholesome roots to be dedicated to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level, except for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas @236b kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas @236b kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du mi rtag ces bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang /
translated: He teaches the doctrine that the ten powers of a tathāgata are impermanent, and he teaches the doctrine that those [attributes] are not apprehended, and he teaches the doctrine that the ten powers of a tathāgata are suffering, and he teaches the doctrine that they are selfless, and he teaches the doctrine that they are impure, and he teaches the doctrine that they are calm, and he teaches the doctrine that they are void, and he teaches the doctrine that they are afflicted, and he teaches the doctrine that they are purified, and he teaches the doctrine that they are not to be purified, and he teaches the doctrine that the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are impermanent, and he teaches the doctrine that those [attributes] are not apprehended, and he teaches the doctrine that the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are suffering, and he teaches the doctrine that they are selfless, and he teaches the doctrine that they are impure, and he teaches the doctrine that they are calm, and he teaches the doctrine that they are void, and he teaches the doctrine that they are afflicted, and he teaches the doctrine that they are purified, and he teaches the doctrine that they are not to be purified, and he teaches the doctrine that the knowledge of all aspects is impermanent, and he teaches the doctrine that those [attributes] are not apprehended, and he teaches the doctrine that the knowledge of all aspects is suffering, and he teaches the doctrine that it is selflessness, and he teaches the doctrine that it is impurity, and he teaches the doctrine that it is calm, and he teaches the doctrine that it is void, and he teaches the doctrine that it is afflicted, and he teaches the doctrine that it is purified, and he teaches the doctrine that it is not to be purified.

original: zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang /
translated: “peace,” “empty,” “signless,” “wishless,” “unconditioned,” and “isolated,”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: and for the sake of meditation on the distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi bar du bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi bar du bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston cing /
translated: and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma gtogs par nyan thos kyi sa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yongs su bsngor mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of paths,🔽and for the sake of meditation on the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du shes par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that this is a bodhisattva great being’s spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos na /🔽mi 'jigs / mi dngangs /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen des yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos na / mi 'jigs / mi dngangs /
translated: The bodhisattva great being who is assisted by that spiritual friend, when they hear this perfection of wisdom,

original: skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be afraid, will not be terrified,🔽and will not be overcome with fear.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽shes rab kyi @237a *//
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / shes rab kyi @237a *//
translated: how is it that when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos na /
translated: when they hear this teaching on the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jigs shing dngangs la skrag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'jigs shing dngangs la skrag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: they are afraid, terrified, and overcome with fear,

original: thabs mi mkhas te /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas te /
translated: and are not skilled in means,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par ltung zhing; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su spangs pa lags /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par ltung zhing; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su spangs pa lags /
translated: fall into the clutches of bad friends, and are abandoned by good friends?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba med par /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba med par /
translated: without attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: they cultivate and objectify the perfection of wisdom.🔽They falsely project the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: They cultivate and objectify the perfection of concentration.🔽They falsely project the perfection of concentration.🔽They cultivate and objectify the perfection of perseverance.🔽They falsely project the perfection of perseverance.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: They cultivate and objectify the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: and they cultivate and focus on the perfection of morality,🔽and through that perfection of morality they become conceited,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom zhing dmigs te /
translated: and they cultivate and focus on the perfection of giving,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa de lta bu ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa des rlom sems su byed pa de lta bu ni /
translated: and through that perfection of giving they become conceited.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems @237b dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems @237b dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, such is the lack of skill in means on the part of great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba med par /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba med par /
translated: are without attention that is focused on omniscience,

original: gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they will attend to the notion that physical forms are empty of inherent existence.

original: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that physical forms are ‘empty of external things.’🔽They pay attention to the idea that physical forms are ‘empty of external and internal things.’

original: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that physical forms are ‘empty of inherent existence.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are ‘empty of internal things.’

original: rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that consciousness is ‘empty of external things.’🔽They pay attention to the idea that consciousness is ‘empty of external and internal things.’

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing /🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that consciousness is ‘empty of inherent existence.’🔽They pay attention to the idea that inner emptiness is an objective entity.

original: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs / phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that outer emptiness is an objective entity.🔽They pay attention to the idea that outer and inner emptiness is an objective entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang dmigs la /
translated: They pay attention to the idea that the emptiness of essential nature with regard to non-apprehension is an objective entity.

original: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do //🔽mig nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do // mig nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They become conceited because of those emptinesses.🔽They pay attention to ‘the eye is empty of an inner emptiness.’

original: mig phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the eye is empty of an outer emptiness.’

original: mig phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the eye is empty of an outer and inner emptiness.’

original: mig dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽rna ba @238a *//
analyzed: mig dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed / rna ba @238a *//
translated: They pay attention to ‘the eye is empty of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.’

original: dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽yid phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / yid phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty of an inner emptiness.’🔽They pay attention to ‘the thinking mind is empty of an outer emptiness.’

original: yid phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: yid phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the thinking mind is empty of an outer and inner emptiness.’

original: yid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing /🔽dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: yid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed cing / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They pay attention to ‘the thinking mind is empty of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.’🔽They pay attention to inner emptiness as a non-apprehending emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They pay attention to outer emptiness as a non-apprehending emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They pay attention to outer and inner emptiness as a non-apprehending emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de'ang dmigs la /
translated: They also apprehend the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities,🔽and they are conceited about those emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do; ;gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems su byed do; ;gzugs nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / gzugs phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They attend to the notion that form is the inner emptiness,🔽they attend to the notion that form is the outer emptiness,

original: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they attend to the notion that form is the inner and outer emptiness,

original: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they attend to the notion that form is the emptiness that is the essential nature of non-entities.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /🔽chos phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed / chos phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: They attend to the notion that sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are the inner emptiness,🔽they attend to the notion that sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are the outer emptiness,

original: chos phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: chos phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they attend to the notion that sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are the inner and outer emptiness,

original: chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed de /
analyzed: chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed de /
translated: and they attend to the notion that sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are the emptiness that is the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They also apprehend the inner emptiness by way of apprehending it,

original: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: They apprehend external emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid de'ang dmigs /
translated: they apprehend the emptiness of the internal and the external,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de'ang dmigs la /
translated: and they apprehend up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems @238b su byed do //🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de dag gis kyang rlom sems @238b su byed do // mig gi rnam par shes pa nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they are conceited about those kinds of emptiness.🔽They pay attention to the thought that the eye consciousness is empty of internal phenomena,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the thought that the eye consciousness is empty of external phenomena,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi nang stong pa zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: they pay attention to the thought that the eye consciousness is empty of both internal and external phenomena,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya bar yid la byed /
translated: and they pay attention to the thought that the eye consciousness is empty of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.
